com.zberman2.Tests

Class MasterTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zberman2.Tests.MasterTest

  • public class MasterTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which tests the functionality of the Master class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MasterTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Set up stalemateBoard with a stalemate configuration, checkmateBoard with a checkmate configuration, and chessboard with the queen above
      void testFindPiece()
      Test that findPiece returns null for empty spaces, and the correct piece for occupied spaces
      void testIsCheck()
      Test that the Black king is in check on the checkmateBoard, but the White king is not.
      void testIsCheckmate()
      Test that the black king is mated on the checkmate board and that he is not on the stalemate board
      void testIsStalemate()
      Test that there is a stalemate if it is the Black side's turn on the stalemateBoard, but not if the White side is up.
      void testMove()
      Test that the queen can only move to valid spaces on the board

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Set up stalemateBoard with a stalemate configuration, checkmateBoard with a checkmate configuration, and chessboard with the queen above
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testFindPiece

        public void testFindPiece()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that findPiece returns null for empty spaces, and the correct piece for occupied spaces
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testMove

        public void testMove()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that the queen can only move to valid spaces on the board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testIsCheck

        public void testIsCheck()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that the Black king is in check on the checkmateBoard, but the White king is not. Also check that the black king is not in check on the stalemate board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testIsCheckmate

        public void testIsCheckmate()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that the black king is mated on the checkmate board and that he is not on the stalemate board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testIsStalemate

        public void testIsStalemate()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that there is a stalemate if it is the Black side's turn on the stalemateBoard, but not if the White side is up. Also check that there are no legal moves for the Black side in the checkmate board, but because the King is in check, it is not a stalemate
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
